card-header.title: Internet of Things: Privacy and Trust on the IoT

card-body.title: Unsavory services can expose digital identities and personal information via the Internet of Things
card-body.content: The current generation of heavy internet users are digital denizens, creating curated online personas out of heaps of information uploaded to social media sites. These people are also generating detailed “digital exhaust” via the Internet of Things-connected devices with which they either knowingly or unknowingly engage.

card-header.title: Internet of Things: Making the rules for a Beneficial IoT

card-body.title: The Internet of Things can truly benefit society if the right kind of governance is in place
card-body.content: The rapid but relatively uncoordinated evolution of the Internet of Things, a technology that makes our essential machines and devices smarter by connecting them to the web, has led to decentralized systems that lack proper governance.

card-header.title: Internet of Things: IoT Value Creation and Business Models

card-body.title: The Internet of Things can help a number of industries thrive
card-body.content: The Internet of Things can improve efficiency and productivity as it connects everyday machines via the web - but it cannot create value out of nothing. It requires significant innovation, greater investment, and broader participation in every industry where it is poised to have an impact.

card-header.title: Internet of Things: Safety, Security and the IoT

card-body.title: Merging the digital and physical worlds via the Internet of Things creates new security challenges
card-body.content: The Internet of Things, which is stringing the world around us together via the web, is melding the digital and the physical realms in a way that creates threats that have not been anticipated by conventional cyber security systems.

card-header.title: Internet of Things: Architecture and Standards

card-body.title: The Internet of Things requires thoughtful architecture and standard selection
card-body.content: The Internet of Things, which is rapidly connecting everything from doorbells to dams to the web, requires scalable, future-proof, and cost-effective architectural choices in order to thrive.
